objkt.name: Cuaderno #35

metadata.name: Cuaderno #35
metadata.description:
Cuaderno is the Spanish word for notebook.
The piece represents the rupture of the most basic tool of the artist, traditional or digital.

issuer.name: Cuaderno

objkt.name: THE WORD AFTER US: An AI poetry unreading #328

metadata.name: THE WORD AFTER US: An AI poetry unreading #328
metadata.description:
“Where in the world will words go, 
after us? How will they be arranged, 
and what will they sound like
when they arrive at their destination?
What will they be doing?
What will the world be doing?
Will the words be quiet or loud?
Will they be full of themselves,
or full of longing,
or full of longing’s opposite?”
 
An ars poetica on the future of literature and humanity. 
 
This project is a one-time generative poetry performance of a transhuman text by Sasha Stiles and her AI alter ego, Technelegy – read and unread by an algorithm authored by Nathaniel Stern. Every hash transforms one of 353 lines of AI-written poetry from legible letters into wordless language, generating a unique textblock from millions of possible combinations; each algorithmic translation unwrites itself, forever. Press "s" to overlay and toggle the original line of verse, and watch its shapes and meanings degenerate – or evolve – into an infinite visual poem.
 
All minters will receive an airdropped broadside (mp4) of the entire original poem after the performance is complete. A 1/1 media-rich audiovisual version of THE WORD AFTER US will also be made available.

 
Poetic traits:
- 353 possible lines of generative poetry produced by a GPT-3 language model fine-tuned on Stiles’ and Stern’s writing and research.
- 28 possible color palette combinations selected from Stern’s performative scanner art, with rare palettes including RGB, Hacker, Charcoal, and Chalkboard (black background).
- 6 possible fonts, including the premiere of Stern and Stiles’ custom AI font, NNFT (Neural Network Font Type), developed for their ongoing collaboration, “Mother Computer.”
- millions of layout and layering possibilities, including a rare “spiral” effect.
- billions of animation attribute combinations, which carry on forever.

attributes.name: Line
attributes.value: 12: Where in the world will words go,

issuer.name: THE WORD AFTER US: An AI poetry unreading

objkt.name: A Slight Case of Overbombing #16

metadata.name: A Slight Case of Overbombing #16
metadata.description:
Inspired by monochromatic art of the late 60s, Russian folk-art woodblock prints, and the stylised colours of British underground comics, excited to introduce a series of bold rich landscapes. England, Wales, Ireland and Scotland represented by red, yellow, green and blue, sometimes a house or two, and groovy clouds.

Instructions ::

.     - speed up
,     - slow down
space - pause
n     - toggle noise
p     - cycle palette
h     - toggle high-res (and definitely intentional pixel shift)
s     - download and save image

issuer.name: A Slight Case of Overbombing

objkt.name: House of Birds #64

metadata.name: House of Birds #64
metadata.description:
"House of Birds" started as a few origami birds inside a frame.
But, birds don't need boundaries; birds need trees, hills, and sky.

Created using p5js;

Press "s" to save as png.

Twitter: @SapirCohen__

issuer.name: House of Birds

objkt.name: Momentary #139

metadata.name: Momentary #139
metadata.description:
Sometimes, life's troubles seem to be immense and endless. They make us run around in despair, helplessly looking in every direction in search of an answer.

It's tough to be in control of those situations until we understand that everything in our life is momentary, the good times are momentary and of course the bad ones.

We tend to forget that life finds its way and that we just need to hold enough to start to see a clear path to follow.

Life is momentary, the good times are momentary and of course the bad ones.

Hold enough.

There is a path to follow.

-------
WARNING
Please, have into consideration that this work requires some CPU power due to the number of points that needs to be drawn on the canvas. Depending on the hardware and work features, the drawing could take some seconds to some minutes to be finished. 
-------

/- Features

/- Color Scheme
-. Vintage graphite
-. Ashes
-. Serenity
-. Blossom
-. Dark chocolate
-. Blue pen

/- Sky Texture
-. Pencil strokes left
-. Pencil strokes right
-. Pointed lines diagonal
-. Pointed lines vertical
-. Crosshatch
-. Clean

/- Celestial Object
-. Fire burst type A
-. Fire burst type B
-. Eclipse
-. Flare
-. Void

/- Terrain QTY.
-. 1 to 5

/- Terrain Type
-. Blasted sand
-. Peaceful sand
-. Rocky ridges

/- Terrain accent
-. True
-. False

/- Dripping ridges
-. True
-. False

/- Frame
-. True
-. False

-------

/- Controls

[p] Save image @ 2000x2300 px.
[Backspace] Pause the animation.
[Enter] Play the animation. 

-------

issuer.name: Momentary

objkt.name: Growth v02 #24

metadata.name: Growth v02 #24
metadata.description:
Growth patterns, version 2. January 2022
Edition of 512

Growth v02 is an generative exploration of patterns in the style of William Morris' iconic wallpaper designs from the 1800s. The code for the Growth series was originally designed to create plausible road networks but has been rewritten to create more organic curved forms. Created with p5js.

'space' to pause the simulation
'h' to toggle to higher res (increases canvas size but runs slower: great for screengrabs)
'r' to reset the seed (some features are locked to the original hash)
's' to save an image to disk
All generated patterns are tile-able horizontally and vertically.

Licensed under CC BY-NC-SA 4.0

This project relies heavily on randomly generated values. It has been thoroughly tested. However, there is always the chance that the wrong combination of randomness can create less-compelling growth. If you feel you version is not living up to the potential promised with this piece, please email me.

issuer.name: Growth v02

objkt.name: a house divided #89

metadata.name: a house divided #89
metadata.description:
This piece reuses the same line drawing algorithm from 'this is where i draw the line', meant to emulate a marker drawing on paper.

In terms of composition, we start with a single square, which we divide into two rectangles, either horizontally or vertically. We then repeat this process some number of times for each of the resulting rectangles. Finally, we fill the rectangles by drawing them with lines. These lines
can be either straight or curved.

The collection of inks and papers has also been expanded from 'this is where i draw the line'. Collectors of that piece have been placed on the reserve list as a thank you for their support.

This piece was created using p5.js

issuer.name: a house divided

objkt.name: Equanimity #236

metadata.name: Equanimity #236
metadata.description: Equanimity shows the algorithm in its search for balance in color and composition. All mints eventually converge to a stable state. If this takes longer than 40 seconds, the captured thumbnail will be different from the final result. Implemented in 5773 hand-crafted characters of JS code. Forever limited to 496 unique editions living on the Tezos blockchain. London - December 2021.

issuer.name: Equanimity
